revised_title: Friction-Induced Oscillatory Behavior of One-Dimensional Detonations: A Study on Detonation Wave Propagation in Rough Tubes
tldr: This study investigates the propagation of detonation waves in rough tubes, focusing on the effects of frictional drag on the wave's behavior. The authors use the unsteady quasi-one-dimensional reactive Euler equations to analyze the competition between chemical energy release and frictional drag, which can lead to oscillatory detonation behavior and the non-existence of a steady wave solution. The research provides insights into the dynamics of detonation waves and their interaction with the surrounding environment.
